snippet: The authorities arrested Abdul Rahman Haroun, who evaded 400 security cameras and walked about 30 miles underground, dodging trains traveling at up to 100 miles per hour.
abstract: Sudanese migrant Abdul Rahman Haroun walks almost entire length of Channel Tunnel in effort to reach Britain from Calais, France, before he is apprehended by police; journey makes headlines on both sides of channel, reducing sprawling migration crisis to human scale; nearly 1,000 attempts by migrants trying to get to England are reportedly made each day.
lead_paragraph: The authorities arrested Abdul Rahman Haroun, who evaded 400 security cameras and walked about 30 miles underground, dodging trains traveling at up to 100 miles per hour.

headline.main: In a First, a Sudanese Migrant Nearly Crosses the English Channel on Foot
headline.print_headline: In a First, a Migrant Nearly Crosses the English Channel on Foot

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
